fields.headline: Schofield rewards Lancashire's faith
fields.bodyText: This has been another miserable season for Chris Schofield but Lancashire will hope the former England leg-spinner started his rehabilitation last night A winter at the Adelaide academy failed to sort out the problems that have plagued Schofield's bowling since he was given one of the first England contracts in 2000 and, in addition to playing only one championship match this season, he has recently slipped out of Lancashire's one-day team But Lancashire's manager Mike Watkinson is hoping that Schofield can rebuild his fragile bowling confidence with the bat and threw him in at No5 instead of Neil Fairbrother, who was omitted after four consecutive ducks The 23-year-old came in at a tricky time, with Lancashire stuttering at 102 for three after losing Stuart Law and David Byas in consecutive overs. But Schofield's unorthodoxy at once unsettled Sussex and his 36 from 50 balls was the top score of the Lancashire innings, although he did not finish the job and it needed a lusty boundary from John Wood off the first ball of the last over from Kevin Innes to complete a win which retains Lancashire's mathematical chance of promotion Sussex, however, remain rock bottom of the Second Division, their players continuing to show ingratitude for their committee's boldness in installing permanent floodlights four years ago They slumped to 79 for six after Chris Adams chose to bat first and, even after Matt Prior and Innes had steadied the ship with a seventh-wicket stand of 45, they both threw their wickets away Glen Chapple did the early damage with the wickets of Adams, Richard Montgomerie and Tony Cottey, the last two both caught behind by Jamie Haynes, who was deputising behind the stumps for the injured Warren Hegg Kyle Hogg then confirmed what Lancashire have been missing during his lengthy absence with England's under-19s by having Robin Martin-Jenkins and Murray Goodwin caught by Haynes. Martin-Jenkins walked but Goodwin was reluctant to go even when given out. The Zimbabwean had struck five fours in his 40, his best score in a lean League season.
